prompt.p: A medical student is shadowing a hospital pharmacist.
Which of the following drugs causes hyperkalaemia?

modalFeedback.p: Option C (Heparin) is Correct. This is due to inhibition of aldosterone secretion, which results in hyperkalaemia.
Option A (Ciprofloxacin) is Incorrect. This has no effect on potassium levels.
Option B (Codeine phosphate) is Incorrect. This has no effect on potassium levels.
Option D (Levothyroxine) is Incorrect. This has no effect on potassium levels.
Option E (Salbutamol) is Incorrect. This can cause hypokalaemia. Salbutamol is used as treatment of hyperkalaemia.
